text:
This time around Christmas is a weird one for open source.
People who are doing open source for fun have more free time and do more open source.
People who are lucky enough do open source for work do less (of that) open source since they are on holidays.
and one effect of that is probably more PRs waiting for review, since people maintaining projects are biased (perhaps only slightly) towards being paid to do so.
Where as if its for fun one tends to be doing more minor contributions and less of the maintaince code review stuff

text:
I am being hit on this on both sides.
There are cool PRs being made to ChainRules, that is work I am on leave from.
and I am waiting for things to be reviewed on DexLang that I am doing for fun.
